thread.title: Air Travel News: A Garden at Kennedy; a Forecast for Lower Fares
thread.title_full: Air Travel News: A Garden at Kennedy; a Forecast for Lower Fares - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Air Travel News: A Garden at Kennedy; a Forecast for Lower Fares
text:
JETBLUE PLANTS A GARDEN AT KENNEDY
Bringing urban agriculture to the airport, JetBlue unveiled its T5 Farm last week at Terminal 5 at Kennedy Airport in New York. Located pre-security on the departures level, the 24,000-square-foot container garden is planted with blue potatoes, herbs and vegetables including beets and arugula. The airline plans to provide the food for some of the terminalâ€™s restaurants, donate some of the harvest to local pantries and eventually supply the potatoes to the Terra company, which makes its signature in-flight blue potato chips. Passengers can visit the curbside farm, and JetBlue plans to offer it as an agricultural model for local schools.
